intro: Impatiens diepenhorstii, commonly known as Diepenhorst's impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of western Africa. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family, characterized by its showy, brightly colored flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually pink or red, with five petals and a distinctive spur at the base. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense forests.
